sections.heading: What is の (no) in Questions?
sections.content:
の (no) at the end of a sentence turns it into a casual question. It's softer and more conversational than using か, and is extremely common in everyday Japanese.

Without の: 行く？ (simple question) With の: 行くの？ (softer, more curious) "Are you going?"

children.heading: With Verb Plain Form + の
children.content: 食べるの？ "Are you eating?" 行くの？ "Are you going?" 見るの？ "Are you watching?" するの？ "Are you doing it?"

children.heading: With い-adjectives + の
children.content: 美味しいの？ "Is it delicious?" 高いの？ "Is it expensive?" 難しいの？ "Is it difficult?" 忙しいの？ "Are you busy?"

children.heading: With な-adjectives + なの
children.content: 元気なの？ "Are you well?" 好きなの？ "Do you like it?" 便利なの？ "Is it convenient?" 大丈夫なの？ "Are you okay?"

children.heading: With Nouns + なの
children.content: 学生なの？ "Are you a student?" 日本人なの？ "Are you Japanese?" 本当なの？ "Is it true?" 嘘なの？ "Is it a lie?"

children.heading: の - Casual, Conversational
children.content: 何してるの？ "What are you doing?" (casual, friendly) どこ行くの？ "Where are you going?" (casual) 誰なの？ "Who is it?" (curious tone)

children.heading: か - Neutral or Formal
children.content: 何していますか？ "What are you doing?" (polite) どこに行きますか？ "Where are you going?" (polite) 誰ですか？ "Who is it?" (polite)

children.heading: Curiosity and Interest
children.content:
の adds a sense of genuine interest:

本当に行くの？ "Are you really going?" (curious) それ食べるの？ "Are you going to eat that?" (interested) 今日来るの？ "Are you coming today?" (wanting to know)

children.heading: Seeking Explanation
children.content:
の can imply "why" or request clarification:

A: 学校休む "I'm skipping school" B: え、休むの？ "Huh? You're skipping?" (why?) A: もう帰る "I'm leaving already" B: もう帰るの？ "Already leaving?" (so soon?)

children.heading: Softer than Direct Questions
children.content: More direct: 行く？ Softer: 行くの？ "Going?" More direct: 何？ Softer: 何なの？ "What is it?"

children.heading: Modern Usage
children.content:
の is now considered gender-neutral and used by everyone:

行くの？ - Used by anyone "Going?" 本当なの？ - Used by anyone "Is it true?"

children.heading: Historical Note
children.content: Older generations might consider の slightly more feminine, but this distinction is largely obsolete in modern Japanese.

sections.heading: Polite Version: んですか / のですか

children.heading: んですか (more common)
children.content: 何をしているんですか？ "What are you doing?" どこに行くんですか？ "Where are you going?" 本当なんですか？ "Is it true?" 大丈夫なんですか？ "Are you okay?"

children.heading: のですか (more formal/written)
children.content: 何をしているのですか？ "What are you doing?" そうなのですか？ "Is that so?"

children.heading: With Question Words
children.content: 何してるの？ "What are you doing?" 誰なの？ "Who is it?" どこ行くの？ "Where are you going?" いつ来るの？ "When are you coming?" なんでなの？ "Why?" どうしたの？ "What happened?"

children.heading: Yes/No Questions
children.content: 本当なの？ "Is it true?" 大丈夫なの？ "Are you okay?" 好きなの？ "Do you like it?" わかるの？ "Do you understand?"

children.heading: Confirmation Questions
children.content: そうなの？ "Is that so?" 違うの？ "Is it different?" これなの？ "Is it this?"

children.heading: Present/Future
children.content: 行くの？ "Are you going?" / "Will you go?" 食べるの？ "Are you eating?" / "Will you eat?"

children.heading: Past
children.content: 行ったの？ "Did you go?" 食べたの？ "Did you eat?" 見たの？ "Did you see it?" したの？ "Did you do it?"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 行かないの？ "Aren't you going?" 食べないの？ "Aren't you eating?" 知らないの？ "Don't you know?"

children.heading: Example 1: Between Friends
children.content: A: 明日パーティー行くの？ "Are you going to the party tomorrow?" B: うん、行くよ "Yeah, I'm going" A: 何時に集まるの？ "What time are we meeting?" B: 7時だよ "7 o'clock"

children.heading: Example 2: Expressing Concern
children.content: A: 顔色悪いね "You look pale" B: そう？ "Really?" A: 大丈夫なの？ "Are you okay?" B: ちょっと疲れてるだけ "I'm just a bit tired"

children.heading: Example 3: Shopping Together
children.content: A: これ買うの？ "Are you buying this?" B: うん、可愛いでしょ？ "Yeah, it's cute, right?" A: いくらなの？ "How much is it?" B: 3000円 "3000 yen"

children.heading: 〜の？〜の？ (Multiple Questions)
children.content:
Shows excitement or curiosity:

本当なの？本当なの？ "Is it true? Really true?" 誰が来るの？何人来るの？ "Who's coming? How many people?"

children.heading: なんで〜の？ (Why)
children.content: なんで行かないの？ "Why aren't you going?" なんで泣いてるの？ "Why are you crying?" なんで知ってるの？ "How do you know?"

children.heading: どうして〜の？ (Why - slightly softer)
children.content: どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" どうして怒ってるの？ "Why are you angry?"

sections.heading: Contraction: ん
sections.content:
In rapid speech, の contracts to ん:

Full: 何してるの？ Contracted: 何してるん？ "What are you doing?" Full: 行くの？ Contracted: 行くん？ "Going?" Full: 本当なの？ Contracted: 本当なん？ "Is it true?"

Note: This is very casual!

children.heading: 〜のかな (wondering)
children.content: 行くのかな？ "I wonder if they're going?" 本当なのかな？ "I wonder if it's true?" できるのかな？ "I wonder if I can do it?"

children.heading: 〜のかしら (feminine, old-fashioned)
children.content: 来るのかしら？ "I wonder if they'll come?" 大丈夫なのかしら？ "I wonder if it's okay?"

children.heading: 〜のよ (feminine, explaining)
children.content: A: どうして？ "Why?" B: 忙しいのよ "I'm busy!" (feminine)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using の after です/ます
children.content: Wrong: 行きますの？ ❌ Right: 行くの？ ✓ (casual) Right: 行きますか？ ✓ (polite) Right: 行くんですか？ ✓ (polite with explanatory tone)

children.heading: Mistake 2: Forgetting な with nouns/な-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 学生の？ ❌ Right: 学生なの？ ✓ "Are you a student?" Wrong: 好きの？ ❌ Right: 好きなの？ ✓ "Do you like it?"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using in formal situations
children.content: Inappropriate: 社長、行くの？ ❌ Better: 社長、行かれますか？ ✓ "President, are you going?"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Overusing in polite conversation
children.content: Too casual: 先生、これ何なの？ ⚠️ Better: 先生、これは何ですか？ ✓ "Teacher, what is this?"

children.heading: ✓ Good Situations
children.content: Talking with friends Family conversations Close colleagues Casual settings Showing genuine interest

children.heading: ✗ Avoid
children.content: Formal business situations Talking to superiors First meetings Very polite contexts Official settings

children.heading: Surprise
children.content: え、本当なの？！ "What, really?!" 知らなかったの？ "You didn't know?!" そうだったの？ "It was like that?!"

children.heading: Concern
children.content: 大丈夫なの？ "Are you okay?" 痛いの？ "Does it hurt?" 辛いの？ "Is it tough?"

children.heading: Curiosity
children.content: それ何なの？ "What's that?" 誰が言ったの？ "Who said that?" どうやったの？ "How did you do it?"

children.heading: 〜のよ (feminine, emphatic)
children.content: 知ってるのよ "I know!" (feminine) 違うのよ "It's different!" (feminine)

children.heading: 〜のね (seeking agreement)
children.content: 美味しいのね "It's delicious, isn't it?" そうなのね "So that's how it is"

children.heading: 〜の？ね？ (double checking)
children.content: 行くの？ね？ "You're going, right?" 本当なの？ね？ "It's true, right?"

children.heading: Basic Questions
children.content: 何してるの？ "What are you doing?" どこ行くの？ "Where are you going?" 誰と会うの？ "Who are you meeting?" いつ来るの？ "When are you coming?"

children.heading: With Adjectives
children.content: 美味しいの？ "Is it delicious?" 楽しいの？ "Is it fun?" 大変なの？ "Is it tough?" 好きなの？ "Do you like it?"

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content: 学生なの？ "Are you a student?" 本当なの？ "Is it true?" 嘘なの？ "Is it a lie?" これなの？ "Is it this?"

children.heading: Past Tense
children.content: 行ったの？ "Did you go?" 食べたの？ "Did you eat?" 見たの？ "Did you see it?" 楽しかったの？ "Was it fun?"
